contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Onsen'''|温泉町|Onsen-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Mikata District, Hyōgo|Mikata District]], [[Hyōgo Prefecture|Hyōgo]], [[Japan]]. [[Onsen]] is the [[Japanese language|Japanese]] word for [[hot spring]]s and the town is named for the local hot springs. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 7,087 and a [[population density|density]] of 51.35 persons per km². The total area was 138.02 km². On October 1, 2005 Onsen was merged with the town of [[Hamasaka, Hyōgo|Hamasaka]], also from [[Mikata District, Hyōgo|Mikata District]], to form the new town of [[Shin'onsen, Hyōgo|Shin'onsen]]. {{DEFAULTSORT:Onsen, Hyogo}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Hyōgo Prefecture]] {{Hyogo-geo-stub}}
